intro: Tremasperma bona-nox, commonly known as the night-blooming starflower, is a member of the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically open at night. The plant is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and lanceolate, with a smooth texture. It is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
